pull.title: refactor: prohibit direct flags access in CCoinsCacheEntry and remove invalid tests
pull.body:
Similarly to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30849, this cleanup is intended to de-risk https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30673#discussion_r1739909068 by simplifying the coin cache public interface.

`CCoinsCacheEntry` provided general access to its internal flags state, even though, in reality, it could only be `clean`, `fresh`, `dirty`, or `fresh|dirty` (in the follow-up, we will remove `fresh` without `dirty`).

Once it was marked as `dirty`, we couldn’t set the state back to clean with `AddFlags(0)`—tests explicitly checked against that.

This PR refines the public interface to make this distinction clearer and to make invalid behavior impossible, rather than just checked by tests. We don't need extensive access to the internals of `CCoinsCacheEntry`, as many tests were simply validating invalid combinations in this way.

The last few commits push the flags to the edges to make the invalid combinations easier to see.

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

rename.from: coins: prohibit direct flags access in CCoinsCacheEntry and remove invalid tests
rename.to: refactor: prohibit direct flags access in CCoinsCacheEntry and remove invalid tests

events.body:
Concept ACK

Can we remove any other tests that are trying to add flags that are not FRESH or DIRTY and so are now useless?

events.message:
coins: Split up AddFlags to remove invalid states

CCoinsCacheEntry provided general access to its internal flags state, even though in reality it could only be clean, fresh, dirty or fresh|dirty.

After it got dirtied we couldn't set the state back to clean by AddFlags(0) - tests were explicitly checking against that.

This commit cleans up the public interface to make this distinction cleaner and invalid behavior impossible instead of just checked by tests.

coins: Remove direct GetFlags access

We don't need so much access to the internals of CCoinsCacheEntry, since many tests are just exercising invalid combinations this way.

events.body:
> Can we remove any other tests that are trying to add flags that are not FRESH or DIRTY and so are now useless?

I've merged `NO_ENTRY` and `char(0)` values - this simplifies the cases somewhat.
Do you think we can remove any of the lines? There aren't any duplicates, even after the above change...

Edit: moved the booleans closer to the edges in later commits.

events.message:
tests: ValidateFlags in coins_tests

We can't have -1 flags, so used 0 instead of them
tests: split flags in InsertCoinsMapEntry parameters into dirty & fresh
tests: split flags in WriteCoinsViewEntry parameters into dirty & fresh
tests: split flags in SingleEntryCacheTest parameters into dirty & fresh

scripted-diff: use dirty&fresh in test cases instead of flags

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-
sed -i -E 's#((CheckAccessCoin|CheckSpendCoins|CheckAddCoin)\(([^,]+,){3})\s*UNCHANGED\s*#\1 false, false#g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
sed -i -E 's#((CheckAccessCoin|CheckSpendCoins|CheckAddCoin)\(([^,]+,){3})\s*DIRTY\|FRESH\s*#\1 true , true #g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
sed -i -E 's#((CheckAccessCoin|CheckSpendCoins|CheckAddCoin)\(([^,]+,){3})\s*DIRTY\s*#\1 true , false#g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
sed -i -E 's#((CheckAccessCoin|CheckSpendCoins|CheckAddCoin)\(([^,]+,){3})\s*FRESH\s*#\1 false, true #g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp

sed -i -E 's#, char cache_flags,#, bool is_dirty, bool is_fresh,#g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
sed -i -E 's#cache_flags & DIRTY#is_dirty#g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
sed -i -E 's#cache_flags & FRESH#is_fresh#g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp

sed -i -z -E 's#ValidateFlags\(cache_flags\);\n\s+##g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
-END VERIFY SCRIPT-

scripted-diff: use parent dirty&fresh in test cases instead of flags in CheckWriteCoins

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-
sed -i -E 's#(CheckWriteCoins\(([^,]+,){3})\s*UNCHANGED\s*#\1 false, false#g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
sed -i -E 's#(CheckWriteCoins\(([^,]+,){3})\s*DIRTY\|FRESH\s*#\1 true , true #g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
sed -i -E 's#(CheckWriteCoins\(([^,]+,){3})\s*DIRTY\s*#\1 true , false#g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
sed -i -E 's#(CheckWriteCoins\(([^,]+,){3})\s*FRESH\s*#\1 false, true #g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp

sed -i -E 's#, char parent_flags,#, bool parent_is_dirty, bool parent_is_fresh,#g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
sed -i -E 's#parent_flags & DIRTY#parent_is_dirty#g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
sed -i -E 's#parent_flags & FRESH#parent_is_fresh#g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp

sed -i -z -E 's#ValidateFlags\(parent_flags\);\n\s+##g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp

sed -i -E 's#(CheckWriteCoins\(.+, parent_flags)(, .+;)#\1 \& DIRTY, parent_flags \& FRESH\2#g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
-END VERIFY SCRIPT-

scripted-diff: use child dirty&fresh in test cases instead of flags in CheckWriteCoins

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-
sed -i -E 's#(CheckWriteCoins\(([^,]+,){5})\s*UNCHANGED\s*#\1 false, false#g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
sed -i -E 's#(CheckWriteCoins\(([^,]+,){5})\s*DIRTY\|FRESH\s*#\1 true , true #g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
sed -i -E 's#(CheckWriteCoins\(([^,]+,){5})\s*DIRTY\s*#\1 true , false#g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
sed -i -E 's#(CheckWriteCoins\(([^,]+,){5})\s*FRESH\s*#\1 false, true #g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp

sed -i -E 's#, char child_flags,#, bool child_is_dirty, bool child_is_fresh,#g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
sed -i -E 's#child_flags & DIRTY#child_is_dirty#g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
sed -i -E 's#child_flags & FRESH#child_is_fresh#g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp

sed -i -z -E 's#ValidateFlags\(child_flags\);\n\s+##g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp

sed -i -E 's#(CheckWriteCoins\(.+, child_flags)(, .+;)#\1 \& DIRTY, child_flags \& FRESH\2#g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
-END VERIFY SCRIPT-

scripted-diff: use expected dirty&fresh in test cases instead of flags

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-
sed -i -E 's#((CheckAccessCoin|CheckSpendCoins|CheckAddCoin)\(([^,]+,){5})\s*UNCHANGED\s*#\1 false, false#g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
sed -i -E 's#((CheckAccessCoin|CheckSpendCoins|CheckAddCoin)\(([^,]+,){5})\s*DIRTY\|FRESH\s*#\1 true , true #g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
sed -i -E 's#((CheckAccessCoin|CheckSpendCoins|CheckAddCoin)\(([^,]+,){5})\s*DIRTY\s*#\1 true , false#g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
sed -i -E 's#((CheckAccessCoin|CheckSpendCoins|CheckAddCoin)\(([^,]+,){5})\s*FRESH\s*#\1 false, true #g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp

sed -i -E 's#(CheckWriteCoins\(([^,]+,){7})\s*UNCHANGED\s*#\1 false, false#g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
sed -i -E 's#(CheckWriteCoins\(([^,]+,){7})\s*DIRTY\|FRESH\s*#\1 true , true #g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
sed -i -E 's#(CheckWriteCoins\(([^,]+,){7})\s*DIRTY\s*#\1 true , false#g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
sed -i -E 's#(CheckWriteCoins\(([^,]+,){7})\s*FRESH\s*#\1 false, true #g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp

sed -i -E 's#, char expected_flags#, bool expected_is_dirty, bool expected_is_fresh#g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
sed -i -E 's#( +)BOOST_CHECK_EQUAL\(result_flags, expected_flags\)#\1BOOST_CHECK_EQUAL(!!(result_flags \& DIRTY), expected_is_dirty);\n\1BOOST_CHECK_EQUAL(!!(result_flags \& FRESH), expected_is_fresh)#g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp

sed -i -z -E 's#ValidateFlags\(expected_flags\);\n\s+##g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp

sed -i -E 's#(CheckWriteCoins\(.+, parent_flags)(\);)#\1 \& DIRTY, parent_flags \& FRESH\2#g' src/test/coins_tests.cpp
-END VERIFY SCRIPT-
Update headers after scripted diff + reformat
Migrate GetCoinsMapEntry to return CoinMapEntry instead

comments.body: Because class declarations don't need semicolons, but I'll revert if you find it distracting
Replaced it with a flag validation

Since we don't pass a bitmap as flags anymore, does it make sense to get rid of the `char` type for flags in `coins_tests` and replace with a more descriptive enum?
```C++
enum Flags
{
   Clean,
   Dirty,
   Fresh,
   DirtyAndFresh
};
```

Could also be a `std::optional<Flags>` so we can handle the `NO_ENTRY` case cleanly instead of with a `-1`.

what's the difference between clean and NO_ENTRY? Does that difference still make sense after this change?

> get rid of the char type for flags in coins_tests and replace with a more descriptive enum

Since we don't have flags in the production code anymore I would prefer getting rid of them in the tests as well. Reintroducing an enum would kinda' defeat that purpose in my opinion.

To make sure the tests are still checking the same combinations, I have added a few scripted diffs to transition the tests away from the flags - now the tabular data displays dirty and fresh booleans instead (I guess we can group some of the examples into `CoinMapEntry` as well, if needed).
This should help us selectively decide which combinations are still valid.
What do you think?

`Clean` means not dirty and not fresh. `NO_ENTRY` is a special value that is not a possible flag but signals to the tests that that entry does not exist. With proper types, that would correspond to a `std::nullopt`.
We don't have to name the enum `Flags`, we can name it `EntryState`. That way we don't have to validate the `flags` variable to see if it's one of the values we will accept. That is better served by using an enum and std::optional.
